hints_html:
The formula for the average value of a function is

\(f_{av} = \frac{1}{b-a}\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\, dx\)
hints_latex:
The formula for the average value of a function is

$f_{av} = \frac{1}{b-a}\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\, dx$
hints_raw:
The formula for the average value of a function is

<math>
f_{av} = \frac{1}{b-a}\int_{a}^{b}f(x)\, dx
</math>
question: 1 (a)
sols_html:
Applying the formula gives

\(f_{av} = \frac{1}{\pi-0}\int_{0}^{\pi}\cos x\, dx = \frac1{\pi} \sin(x) |_{0}^{\pi} = \frac{\sin(\pi) - \sin(0)}{\pi} = 0\)
sols_latex:
Applying the formula gives

$f_{av} = \frac{1}{\pi-0}\int_{0}^{\pi}\cos x\, dx = \frac1{\pi} \sin(x) |_{0}^{\pi} = \frac{\sin(\pi) - \sin(0)}{\pi} = 0$
sols_raw:
Applying the formula gives

<math>
f_{av} = \frac{1}{\pi-0}\int_{0}^{\pi}\cos x\, dx = \frac1{\pi} \sin(x) |_{0}^{\pi} = \frac{\sin(\pi) - \sin(0)}{\pi} = 0
</math>
statement_html: Find the average value of \(\displaystyle \cos(x)\) on the interval \(\displaystyle [0, \pi].\)
statement_latex:
Find the average value of $\displaystyle \cos(x)$ on the interval
$\displaystyle [0, \pi].$
statement_raw: Find the average value of <math>\displaystyle \cos(x) </math> on the interval <math>\displaystyle [0, \pi]. </math>
